column1: FORT SMITH FUEL CONSUMPTION TRACKER
HOW TO USE THIS WORKBOOK:
1. DOWNLOAD WEATHER DATA
• Go to: https://climate.weather.gc.ca/historical_data/search_historic_data_e.html
• Search for: Fort Smith A (Station ID: 2202201)
• Select: Daily data
• Download: September, October, November 2025
• Copy Max Temp and Min Temp columns into the 'Weather Data' sheet
2. RECORD FUEL FILLS
• Update the 'Fuel Fills' sheet with each delivery
• Record: Date, gauge reading before fill, liters added
• Record: Price per liter and total cost
• Total cost will auto-calculate if you enter price/liter
3. VIEW ANALYSIS
• Check the 'Analysis' sheet for your fuel efficiency (L/HDD)
• This ratio tells you how much fuel you burn per heating degree day
• View cost analysis showing total spending and monthly projections
• Update the estimated price/L (yellow cell) to project future costs
4. PREDICT FUTURE CONSUMPTION
• Use weather forecasts to estimate HDD
• Or use the pre-calculated scenarios (mild/normal/deep winter)
• Enter custom HDD/day in the yellow cell to see predictions
ABOUT HEATING DEGREE DAYS (HDD):
HDD measures how cold it is and how much heating you need.
Formula: HDD = max(0, 18°C - average daily temperature)
Examples:
• If avg temp is -2°C: HDD = 18 - (-2) = 20 HDD
• If avg temp is 10°C: HDD = 18 - 10 = 8 HDD
• If avg temp is 20°C: HDD = 0 (no heating needed)
Typical Fort Smith HDD/day:
• September: 5-8 HDD/day
• October: 10-15 HDD/day
• November: 15-20 HDD/day
• December-February: 20-25+ HDD/day
• March: 15-20 HDD/day
• April: 8-12 HDD/day
